```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(haven)
library(dplyr)
library(knitr)
library(tinytex)
library(ggplot2)
library(GGally)
library(vtable)
library(googlesheets4) #in case want to try import of google sheets
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## Input of Data and Changing Columns
```{r all_ages}
all_ages <- read.csv("data/all-ages.csv")
all_ages <- rename(all_ages, "Employed_Full_Time_Year_Round" = "Employed_full_time_year_round", 
                   "Unemployment_Rate" = "Unemployment_rate", "Percentile_25th" = "P25th", "Percentile_75th" = "P75th")

```



## Tables
```{r sum}
sum_table<-st(all_ages)
sum_table<- dataframe(sum_table)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
